t: Then*p Jonah prayed to the Lord*s his God from the belly of the fish,
saying, “I*pn called out to the Lord,*s out of my distress, and*ld he answered me; out*ln of the belly of Sheol I cried, and*ld you heard my voice.
For*ln you cast me into the deep, into*ld the heart of the seas, and*ld the flood surrounded me; all*ln your waves and your billows passed*ld over me.
Then*ln I said, ‘I am driven away from*ld your sight; yet*ln I shall again look upon*ld your holy temple.’
The*ln waters closed in over me to take my life; the*ld deep surrounded me; weeds*ln were wrapped about my head
at*ld the roots of the mountains. I*ln went down to the land whose*ld bars closed upon me forever; yet*ln you brought up my life from the pit, O*ld Lord*s my God.
When*ln my life was fainting away, I*ld remembered the Lord,*s and*ln my prayer came to you, into*ld your holy temple.
Those*ln who pay regard to vain idols forsake*ld their hope of steadfast love.
But*ln I with the voice of thanksgiving will*ld sacrifice to you; what*ln I have vowed I will pay. Salvation*ld belongs to the Lord!”*s
And*p the Lord*s spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah out upon the dry land.
